content.description: Sit start matched on a good pocket. From there, either make a big pull to the jugs above or bump through the arete, then work onto the slab using the bumps on top, and mantel for the finish.
content.protection: At least a pair of pads. The problem climbs over a built rock landing.
content.location: It climbs the arete on Sesh's south face.

content.description:
Sit start with a low right hand edge and a sloping left hand gaston. From there, bump up to a great rail, follow to the crack, and mantel atop the boulder.

Be cautious with the right hand rail. I cleaned most of the loose out but there is still some remaining.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work well. The landing is a built pile of rocks.
content.location: It climbs the west section of Sesh's south face.

content.description:
Sit start with a good right hand bump and a left hand on the sloping lip. From there, gain a left hand mono-pocket, bring your feet onto the slab, reach a left hand edge, follow to the high shelf, and mantel on top.

Both aretes are off.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is good.
content.location: It climbs the south face slab of Sesh.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on the bulge. From there, gain the arete, and follow it to the boulder's apex.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing is good.
content.location: Climb the southeast arete of Sesh.
